summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from July to September 2019 between defense attorney Joseph E. Nascimento and federal prosecutors (likely from the SDNY) regarding scheduling meetings and a proffer session for an unnamed client (contextually, likely Ghislaine Maxwell) in the Epstein investigation. It references a grand jury subpoena and proactive cooperation in another case.

persons.name: Joseph E. Nascimento
persons.context: Attorney communicating with federal prosecutors to schedule meetings and a proffer session for his client, likely Ghislaine Maxwell, in relation to the Epstein investigation. He mentions being a former partner of Alan Ross.

persons.name: Alan Ross
persons.context: Deceased former law partner of Joseph Nascimento who previously represented an unnamed individual (likely Ghislaine Maxwell). His former client was served with a grand jury subpoena.

connections.description: Former law partners; Nascimento took over as inventory attorney for Ross's client after Ross's death.
Nascimento is scheduling meetings and a proffer with federal prosecutors on behalf of his client.

events.title: Initial Meeting in West Palm Beach
events.description: A meeting took place between Joseph Nascimento and federal prosecutors at the Hilton in West Palm Beach.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Served
events.description: An unnamed individual (likely Ghislaine Maxwell), formerly represented by Alan Ross, was served with a grand jury subpoena.

events.title: Scheduled Proffer Session
events.description: A proffer session (a meeting where a subject offers information to prosecutors) was scheduled for an unnamed client.

events.title: Proposed Meeting Date
events.description: Prosecutors proposed holding a meeting on August 14th, which Nascimento needed to adjust due to a conflict with proactive cooperation in another multi-jurisdictional case.

locations: 2250 S.W. 3rd Avenue, Miami, FL 33129 (Nascimento's law office)
600 Okeechobee Blvd, West Palm Beach (Hilton hotel)
keyFacts: Attorney Joseph Nascimento is coordinating with federal prosecutors to schedule meetings and a proffer session for an unnamed client in the Epstein case, widely believed to be Ghislaine Maxwell.
The correspondence reveals that the client was previously represented by Alan Ross, who died in 2018, and was served with a grand jury subpoena in July 2019.
Nascimento mentions having 'proactive cooperation ongoing in another case involving multiple jurisdictions,' indicating parallel legal engagements.
Meetings were planned in Florida, primarily in West Palm Beach, suggesting the investigation's activity in that region.
The email chain shows careful scheduling around weather events (a storm) and international travel plans, highlighting the ongoing nature of the investigation in mid-2019.
